subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] how to use?
author: Andrea Carr
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0085_01CAC46C.605CFFA0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Also the hack box works better on AM then FM and don't pull out the antenna=
.

Andrea
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Sumption 
  To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, March 15, 2010 6:07 PM
  Subject: Re:=
 [EVP-ITC] how to use?


    

   That's the thing, most don't realize, no =
matter how many times I say it, the box is nothing but a radio with swept t=
uning. The entities use the resulting bits of speech, music and noise to fo=
rm voices. "The Box" is not some kind of magic spirit communcation device, =
it just a radio, one method of many of supplying the raw audio that spirits=
 and other entiites can use to form voices. 

   You probably bought a "hac=
k" radio. many digital radios have a mute function to turn off  the sound w=
hile the radio sweeps, or searches for stations. If the mute function is ds=
iababled, then the audio is on while sweeping, and it acts exactly like my =
box. In the radio shack radios the mute wire/pin is marked making the hack =
easy and fast.  It's kinda nice form me since I can't mass produce this stu=
ff, and the hack boxes are cheaper by far, and do the same thing. 

   I do=
n't do investigations, or ask questions as is popular with the boxes, I jus=
t announce out loud that I'm doing an EVP recording, and record a few minut=
es, at home. 

   If your box is sweeping across different stations, it's p=
robably working ok, it just takes time to be able to hear "them" as they ta=
lk. Sometimes they use the bits of sounds to make voices, other times it's =
like they come in over the radio stations, and sometimes between stations. =



   Frank-S


   
  On Mon, Mar 15, 2010 at 12:53 PM, <belowprices@yahoo.=
com> wrote:

      
    Hi,
    I did a search online for a Franks Box & wa=
s able to purchase something they said was basically the same. It's called =
a Soul Linx Ghost box (the back says radio shack).
    I don't know how to =
communicate, all I get is plain old radio stations or static. Nothing else.=
 I feel like I bought a radio & that's it. Idea's on what to do, please :(
=
    Thanks,
    Denise
